html:
IRIS CERAMICA REINTERPRETS BURLINGTON STONE IN SURFACE DESIGN

Iris Ceramica (Iris Ceramica Group) captures the essence of Burlington Stone, offering a contemporary reinterpretation of British rocks with its Victorian Stone ceramic surfaces. Crafted using advanced ceramic technology and inspired by the natural formations of the British Lake District, the porcelain stoneware brings a sense of serenity and solidity to modern residential and commercial spaces. Available in various finishes and sizes, Victorian Stone delivers a versatile and sustainable solution for cladding various surfaces, while maintaining a lasting connection to the ancient landscapes that inspire its design.


Victorian Stone captures British lakeland’s rock formations in contemporary ceramic surfaces | all images courtesy of Iris Ceramica

OVER SIX DECADES OF ADVANCED CERAMIC SURFACES 

Known for merging advanced technologies with artisanal craftsmanship, Iris Ceramica continues to create sustainable ceramic surfaces that meet the highest standards of quality and design. With over six decades of expertise, their commitment to research and development remains steady, ensuring that every reference excels in both aesthetics and function. With a global presence, the Italian company stands as a symbol of excellence in ceramic production, enhancing the quality of life through the materials that surround us.


Victorian Stone surfaces blend advanced ceramic technology with the rich textures of Burlington Stone

VICTORIAN STONE REPLICATES HERITAGE OF BRITISH LAKE DISTRICT

Victorian Stone takes its inspiration from the ancient Burlington Stone, found in the rich landscapes of the British Lake District, which is shaped by natural forces over thousands of years. Available in five distinct shades, each color tells a story deeply rooted in nature.

Baycliff Black captures the shadowy depths of the region’s rocky terrain, while Silver Grey reflects the smooth, silvery tones of lakeside pebbles. Forest Green evokes the vibrant energy of the lush forests that blanket the hills, Limestone Beige mirrors the warm, golden hues of the local limestone formations, and Moon Cream brings to mind the soft glow of moonlight on time-worn stone surfaces. Together, these shades offer a rich palette that brings the stone’s noble heritage into contemporary spaces.


each shade, from Baycliff Black to Moon Cream, evokes the heritage of British’s Lake District

Available in formats ranging from 100×100 cm to 60×30 cm, and with a thickness of 6 and 8 mm, the Victorian Stone surfaces offer flexibility for various applications. Specialized finishes like Natural Plus, Flamed, and Structured add texture and depth to walls and floors, while the 20 mm thick outdoor version with an Antislip finish ensures safety in exterior spaces. While replicating the charm of natural stone, the porcelain stoneware provides enhanced durability, resistance to wear, and easy maintenance, making it a perfect choice for modern spaces that seek a combination of refined style and practicality.
